bibl.idno: The Philip S. Hench Walter Reed/Yellow Fever Collection [manuscript] / [collected by] Philip S. Hench ; HEALTHSCI MS-1.

bibl.title: Program from the Fourteenth Annual Dinner of the Kings County Hospital Alumni Association, November 21, 1906

div1.p: This is the program for an evening in honor of Walter Reed, who was once an intern at the hospital. The cover is autographed.

div1.head: Program from the Fourteenth Annual Dinner of the Kings County Hospital Alumni Association,November 21, 1906
div1.p:
Fourteenth Annual Dinner
Raaaweobberd
of the
Kings County Hospital Alumni
Association

ERECTED
BY THE ASSOCIATION OF EX-INTERNES
OF
THE KINGS COUNTY HOSPITAL
TO THE MEMORY OF
WALTER REED, M.D.
INTERNE IN THIS HOSPITAL 1871
MAJOR & SURGEON, U.S.A.
CHAIRMAN U.S. YELLOW FEVER COMMISSION
1900--1901
---
HE ROBBED THE PESTILENCE OF ITS
TERRORS AND CAUSED THE CITIES
OF THE SOUTHLAND TO SIT IN
PEACE WITHIN THEIR GATES

Col. Asst. Surgeon Genl U.S.A.
C.O. Stumff (of Amoy China)
Queens L.J.

FRANKLIN WELKER, M. D., President
C. R. LOVE, M. D., Vice-President
RUSSEL M. ROME, M. D., Secretary and Treasurer

Algernon T. Bristow, M. D., Chairman
John R. Stivers, M. D. Russel M. Rome, M. D.
Edwin H. Fiske, M. D. George L. Stevers, M. D.
John F. Fitzgerald, M. D., Chairman

William Browning, M. D.
William C. Woolsey, M. D.
D. F. Lucas, M. D.
M. T. Lewis, M. D.
Linn Emerson, M. D.
F. E. Lambert, M. D.
George K. Meyner, M. D.
C. F. Barber, M. D.
Thomas R. French, M D.
Edgar Thomson, M. D.
